intro: Aconitum napellus lusus sibiricum, commonly known as Siberian Monkshood, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Siberia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its striking, hood-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant features large, palmately lobed leaves that are deeply divided, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Due to its toxic alkaloids, it is important to handle the plant with care.
